medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient experienced abdominal pain that developed 5 days prior to admission, waking her from sleep. The pain was sharp, centered in her back and radiating to the right flank, significantly worsening at its worst. Following an initial resolution with Percocet, the pain and nausea reoccurred the next night with associated vomiting. She was seen at an emergency department and underwent imaging, which showed gallstones and mild gallbladder wall thickening.
medical_history.past_medical_history: VITAMIN D DEFICIENCY, ALOPECIA, LICHEN SCLEROSIS, PSORIASIS, DIVERTICULITIS s/p SIGMOIDECTOMY due to abscess, APPENDECTOMY.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of lung cancer. Father died of melanoma and had hypertension.
